name: scrapy_spider_framework
description: Build scalable web scrapers with Scrapy framework

args: import scrapy; from scrapy.crawler import CrawlerProcess; class ExampleSpider(scrapy.Spider): name = 'example'; start_urls = ['https://example.com']; def parse(self, response): yield {'title': response.css('title::text').get(), 'heading': response.css('h1::text').get()}; process = CrawlerProcess(settings={'LOG_LEVEL': 'ERROR'}); process.crawl(ExampleSpider); process.start()

import scrapy; from scrapy.crawler import CrawlerProcess; class LinkSpider(scrapy.Spider): name = 'links'; start_urls = ['https://example.com']; def parse(self, response): for link in response.css('a::attr(href)').getall(): print(f'Link: {link}'); process = CrawlerProcess(settings={'LOG_LEVEL': 'ERROR'}); process.crawl(LinkSpider); process.start()

expected_output.example:
Link: https://www.iana.org/domains/example

All links extracted by Scrapy

args: import scrapy; from scrapy.crawler import CrawlerProcess; import json; class DataSpider(scrapy.Spider): name = 'data'; start_urls = ['https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/1']; def parse(self, response): data = json.loads(response.text); print(f'Post title: {data["title"]}'); print(f'Body length: {len(data["body"])} chars'); process = CrawlerProcess(settings={'LOG_LEVEL': 'ERROR'}); process.crawl(DataSpider); process.start()
